McMd::BlockRadiusGyration Class Reference
Diagnostics

Detailed Description

Radius of gyration of different blocks in a molecule.

The radius of gyration R_{g,i} of a block of atom type i is the root mean-squared separation of atoms in a block from the center of mass of block. For a species of molecule with N_i atoms of type i, with positions ,we define

where is the center of mass of block, and where denotes an ensemble average over all molecules of a specified species.

This class calculates the radius of gyration of blocks by accumulating an average value for the above quantity, and optionally outputs block averages to file at an interval specified by the input parameter nSamplePerBlock. No block averages are output if nSamplePerBlock = 0.

Member Function Documentation

void McMd::BlockRadiusGyration::readParam ( std::istream &  in) [virtual]

Read parameters from file, and allocate data array.

Input format:

  • int interval : sampling interval
  • string outputFileName : base name for output file(s)
  • int nSamplePerBlock : interval for output of block averages
  • int speciesId : integer id for Species of interest

No block averages are output if nSamplePerBlock = 0. Otherwise, block averages are output to a file named (outputFileName).dat.

Parameters:
inparameter input stream

Reimplemented from Util::ParamComposite.
